result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony W. Dellach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,156.50 and restitution surcharge.
----------------------------

Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------
Pay Sheriff's warrant fees in the amount of $48.64.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence forthwith.  Conditional jail time may be served in Dane County under electronic monitoring if available to him.
Complete forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation WITHOUT buyout option.

supervisions.notes:

Concurrent with: Concurrent with 2016CF64 but Consecutive to any other sentence defendant is now serving.

Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT
------------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent.
-----------------------------------

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Letter from DOC re: credit / JOC;
Response from Judge Koss - "given no response from either party, amend JOC to provide 241 days credit. PAK"
Original Order to Produce filed with Court.

Transcript of Sentencing After Revocation on 8/23/2018 before the Honorable Phillip A. Koss
Court Reporter : Janet Schulz
Original Order to Produce filed with Court.
Temporary Commitment form filed

11:01 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Anthony W. Dellach in court, in custody with Atty Anthony N Flitcroft.  
Matter is before the court on a sentencing after revocation on two cases.  
Atty Flitcroft has reviewed materials from DOC and has 1 correction in 14CF207 which has incorrect dates as to deft's period of confinement.  
Atty Leusink has no corrections.  Parties do have a joint recommendation as to sentence.  
Atty Leusink makes record as to compliance with victim's rights. 
11:03 am  Atty Flitcroft confirms the agreement of the parties.  
11:04 am  Deft does not wish to make a statement.  
11:04 am  Court makes record and sentences defendant:  

15CF241 - Ct #1:
Total length of sentence is 4 years WSP;  
2 yrs IC followed by 2 yrs ES, conc. with 16CF64 but consecutive to any other sentence deft is serving.  
184 days of sentence credit;  
Court finds defendant is Eligible for CIP and SAP;  
Conditions of extended supervision shall be the same as the original conditions of probation.  

11:08 am  Discussion concerning sentence credit.  Atty Flitcroft states that the total days of sentence credit between all 4 files of Mr. Dellach is 1038 days.   
Court doesn't believe it can apply it toward the imposed and stayed sentence.  

11:10 am  Response by Atty Flitcroft.  Deft went to Dodge Correctional on June 7th on his other files.  Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys as to sentence credit.  Court notes that defendant served the conditional time on 14CF207.  11:18 am  Court goes off record to further discuss sentence credit with the Attys.  

11:23 am  Court back on record.  Same appearances.  Parties have agreed that deft is entitled to credit for the six months conditional time he did on file 15CF241.  So he is entitled to sentence credit of 184 days on both file 16CF64 and file 15CF241.  Court imposes the agreed upon sentence in each file - 15CF241 and 16CF64;  

11:25 am  Court in recess.

*TRANSCRIPT FILED 10/16/18 - Court Reporter : Janet Schulz
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 23, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Atty Anthony Flitcroft
Violation/Revocation Summary.
Application for Jail Time Credit form
